preprocessed_text: use a 2 phillips screwdriver to remove the four screw .
tagged_text: use/NOISE, 2 phillips screwdriver/TOOL, remove/ACTIVITY, four/CARDINALITY, screw/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: remove the rubber gasket from the rain tray .
tagged_text: remove/ACTIVITY, rubber gasket/ITEM, from the rain tray/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: lift the tray upwards and away from the vehicle .
tagged_text: lift/ACTIVITY, tray/ITEM, upwards/SPECIFIER, away from the vehicle/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: use a flathead screwdriver to remove the cap from the windshield wiper .
tagged_text: use/NOISE, flathead screwdriver/TOOL, remove/ACTIVITY, cap/ITEM, windshield wiper/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: use a socket wrench to release the passenger-side windshield wiper locking nut .
tagged_text: use/NOISE, socket wrench/TOOL, release/ACTIVITY, passenger-side/LOCATION, windshield wiper/ITEM, locking nut/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: gently lift up the passenger-side windshield wiper .
tagged_text: gently/SPECIFIER, lift/ACTIVITY, passenger-side/LOCATION, windshield wiper/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: remove the driver-side windshield wiper in the same fashion .
tagged_text: remove/ACTIVITY, driver-side/LOCATION, windshield wiper/ITEM, in the same fashion/NOISE,

preprocessed_text: lift up the plastic cover .
tagged_text: lift up/ACTIVITY, plastic cover/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: use an offset phillips screwdriver to remove a screw in the back of the automatic control unit cover .
tagged_text: use/NOISE, offset phillips screwdriver/TOOL, remove/ACTIVITY, screw/ITEM, in the back of the automatic control unit cover/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: in a pinch , you can make this tool with a phillips driver bit and end wrench .
tagged_text: in a pinch/NOISE, make/ACTIVITY, tool/ITEM, phillips driver bit/TOOL, end wrench/TOOL,

preprocessed_text: use a 2 phillips screwdriver to remove the front two screw .
tagged_text: use/NOISE, 2 phillips screwdriver/TOOL, remove/ACTIVITY, front/LOCATION, two/CARDINALITY, screw/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: gently unplug and lift out the automatic transmission control unit .
tagged_text: gently/SPECIFIER, unplug/ACTIVITY, lift/ACTIVITY, automatic transmission control unit/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: remove the plastic phillips screw towards the front of the door panel .
tagged_text: remove/ACTIVITY, plastic phillips screw/ITEM, front of the door panel/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: use a flathead screwdriver to remove the plastic clip that hold the screw .
tagged_text: use/NOISE, flathead screwdriver/TOOL, remove/ACTIVITY, plastic clip/ITEM, hold/ACTIVITY, screw/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: unscrew the phillips screw in the bottom of the door panel cup .
tagged_text: unscrew/ACTIVITY, phillips screw/ITEM, bottom/LOCATION, door panel cup/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: lift the cup out of the the door panel .
tagged_text: lift/ACTIVITY, cup/ITEM, out of the door panel/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: insert a very thin flathead screwdriver blade into the small gap towards the rear of the car on the plastic screw cover near the door handle .
tagged_text: insert/ACTIVITY, thin/SPECIFIER, flathead screwdriver blade/TOOL, small gap/LOCATION, rear of the car/LOCATION, plastic screw cover/ITEM, door handle/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: unscrew the phillips screw underneath the screw cover .
tagged_text: unscrew/ACTIVITY, phillips screw/ITEM, screw cover/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: remove the plastic cover at the base of the c-pillar by pulling it directly away from the window .
tagged_text: remove/ACTIVITY, plastic cover/ITEM, base/LOCATION, c-pillar/ITEM, pulling it directly away from the window/ACTIVITY,

preprocessed_text: in addition to the metal clip , two small tab at the bottom of the cover keep it in place . gently lift the corner of the door panel to remove the tab from their respective hole in the door .
tagged_text: in addition to the metal clip two small tab at the bottom of the cover keep it in place/NOISE, gently/SPECIFIER, lift/ACTIVITY, corner/LOCATION, door panel/ITEM, remove/ACTIVITY, tab/ITEM, from their respective hole in the door/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: using firm pressure , pull the door panel away from the door . start at the top right , and work down the side , across the bottom , and up the opposite side .
tagged_text: using firm pressure/NOISE, pull/ACTIVITY, door panel/ITEM, away from the door/LOCATION, start at the top right/LOCATION, work down the side/ACTIVITY, across the bottom/LOCATION, up the opposite side/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: pull the bottom of the door panel away from the door , and lift the entire panel off the door .
tagged_text: pull/ACTIVITY, bottom/LOCATION, door panel/ITEM, away from the door/LOCATION, lift/ACTIVITY, entire/SPECIFIER, panel/ITEM, off the door/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: push down on the small tab and pull the connector directly away from it socket to disconnect the power lock switch .
tagged_text: push down/ACTIVITY, small tab/ITEM, pull/ACTIVITY, connector/ITEM, directly away from it socket/LOCATION, disconnect/ACTIVITY, power lock switch/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: use the same method described above to remove the connector for the tweeter .
tagged_text: use/NOISE, same method described above/NOISE, remove/ACTIVITY, connector/ITEM, tweeter/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: press the tab on the bottom of the larger green connector to disconnect the side-view mirror control .
tagged_text: press/ACTIVITY, tab/ITEM, bottom/LOCATION, larger green connector/ITEM, disconnect/ACTIVITY, side-view mirror control/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: disconnect the power window connector .
tagged_text: disconnect/ACTIVITY, power window connector/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: you may now remove the entire door panel .
tagged_text: remove/ACTIVITY, entire/SPECIFIER, door panel/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: use compressed air to clear any debris from the area around the ignition coil on top of the engine .
tagged_text: use/ACTIVITY, compressed air/TOOL, clear/ACTIVITY, debris/ITEM, area around the ignition coil/LOCATION, on top of the engine/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: remove the ignition coil electrical connector by first depressing the plastic tab on top of the connector .
tagged_text: remove/ACTIVITY, ignition coil/ITEM, electrical connector/ITEM, depressing/ACTIVITY, plastic tab/ITEM, top of the connector/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: pull the connector straight away from the ignition coil to detach it .
tagged_text: pull/ACTIVITY, connector/ITEM, straight/SPECIFIER, away from the ignition coil/LOCATION, detach/ACTIVITY,

preprocessed_text: repeat this procedure for the remaining three ignition coil .
tagged_text: repeat this procedure/ACTIVITY, remaining three/CARDINALITY, ignition coil/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: use an 8 mm deep socket to loosen the four ignition coil mounting bolt .
tagged_text: use/NOISE, 8 mm deep socket/TOOL, loosen/ACTIVITY, four/CARDINALITY, ignition coil/ITEM, mounting bolt/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: once the bolt are loose , they can be removed by hand .
tagged_text: once the bolt are loose/NOISE, remove/ACTIVITY, bolt/ITEM, by hand/TOOL,

preprocessed_text: twist the ignition coil and spark plug boot while lifting it straight up to remove it from the engine .
tagged_text: twist/ACTIVITY, ignition coil/ITEM, spark plug boot/ITEM, lifting/ACTIVITY, straight up/LOCATION, remove/ACTIVITY, from the engine/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: use a ratcheting socket wrench with an extender and a 5  or 8 spark plug socket to remove the existing spark plug from the cylinder head . make sure that the spark plug is completely seated in the rubber end of the socket before loosening it .
tagged_text: use/NOISE, ratcheting socket wrench/TOOL, extender/TOOL, 5 or 8 spark plug socket/TOOL, remove/ACTIVITY, existing spark plug/ITEM, cylinder head/LOCATION, make sure/NOISE, completely/SPECIFIER, seated/OBSERVATION, rubber end/ITEM, loosening/ACTIVITY,

preprocessed_text: apply dielectric grease to the ribbed portion of the insulator .
tagged_text: apply/ACTIVITY, dielectric grease/MATERIAL, ribbed portion/ITEM, insulator/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: gently place the spark plug boot over the rib and twist the two piece back and forth to even out the layer of dielectric grease .
tagged_text: gently/SPECIFIER, place/ACTIVITY, spark plug boot/ITEM, rib/ITEM, twist/ACTIVITY, two piece/ITEM, even out/ACTIVITY, layer/ITEM, dielectric grease/MATERIAL,

preprocessed_text: place the new spark plug firmly in the spark plug socket so that the threaded end stick out .
tagged_text: place/ACTIVITY, new spark plug/ITEM, firmly/SPECIFIER, spark plug socket/ITEM, threaded end/ITEM, stick out/ACTIVITY,

preprocessed_text: apply an even layer of anti-seize compound to the thread of the spark plug .
tagged_text: apply/ACTIVITY, even layer/SPECIFIER, anti-seize compound/MATERIAL, thread/ITEM, spark plug/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: place the new spark plug into the cylinder head and tighten it by hand a much a you can .
tagged_text: place/ACTIVITY, new spark plug/ITEM, cylinder head/ITEM, tighten/ACTIVITY, hand/TOOL, much/SPECIFIER, as you can/NOISE,

preprocessed_text: tighten the spark plug to 11 ft-lbs with a torque wrench .
tagged_text: tighten/ACTIVITY, spark plug/ITEM, 11 ft-lbs/SPECIFIER, torque wrench/TOOL,

preprocessed_text: place the ignition coil and dust boot back over the spark plug by pushing down and twisting it into place .
tagged_text: place/ACTIVITY, ignition coil/ITEM, dust boot/ITEM, back over the spark plug/LOCATION, pushing down/ACTIVITY, twisting/ACTIVITY, into place/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: reconnect the ignition coil electrical connector by snapping it back into place .
tagged_text: reconnect/ACTIVITY, ignition coil/ITEM, electrical connector/ITEM, snap/ACTIVITY, back into place/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: pull the hood release latch at the front right of the tractor and lift the hood up .
tagged_text: pull/ACTIVITY, hood release latch/ITEM, front right/LOCATION, tractor/ITEM, lift/ACTIVITY, hood/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: lift the hood prop bar from it seat and place it in the hook on the underside of the hood .
tagged_text: lift/ACTIVITY, hood prop bar/ITEM, seat/LOCATION, place/ACTIVITY, hook/ITEM, underside of the hood/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: pull each tab straight away from the panel and twist them 90 so that they fit through the slot in the panel .
tagged_text: pull/ACTIVITY, each tab/ITEM, straight away from the panel/LOCATION, twist/ACTIVITY, 90/SPECIFIER, fit/ACTIVITY, slot/ITEM, panel/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: pull the top of the engine panel straight out until it is free from the tab .
tagged_text: pull/ACTIVITY, top/LOCATION, engine panel/ITEM, straight out/SPECIFIER, free/OBSERVATION, tab/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: lift the engine panel up to remove it and set it aside .
tagged_text: lift/ACTIVITY, engine panel/ITEM, up/LOCATION, remove/ACTIVITY, set it aside/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: the drain plug is a 17 mm hex bolt located on the underside of the tractor .
tagged_text: the drain plug/ITEM, 17 mm hex bolt/ITEM, located on the underside of the tractor/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: place an oil drain pan underneath the drain plug to catch the oil when it begin to drain .
tagged_text: place/ACTIVITY, oil drain pan/ITEM, underneath the drain plug/LOCATION, catch/ACTIVITY, oil/MATERIAL, begin to drain/ACTIVITY,

preprocessed_text: use a 17 mm box end wrench to loosen the drain plug 3  or 4 of a turn .
tagged_text: use a 17 mm box end wrench/TOOL, loosen/ACTIVITY, drain plug/ITEM, 3 or 4 of a turn/CARDINALITY,

preprocessed_text: loosen the drain plug by hand until it come out and oil begin to drain from the oil pan .
tagged_text: loosen/ACTIVITY, drain plug/ITEM, by hand/TOOL, come out/ACTIVITY, oil/MATERIAL, begin/ACTIVITY, drain/ACTIVITY, oil pan/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: while the oil is draining , wipe off the drain plug with a clean rag or towel .
tagged_text: while the oil is draining/NOISE, wipe/ACTIVITY, drain plug/ITEM, clean/SPECIFIER, rag/MATERIAL, towel/MATERIAL,

preprocessed_text: remove the old drain plug gasket and replace it , making sure that the new gasket fit over the thread of the drain plug .
tagged_text: remove/ACTIVITY, old drain plug gasket/ITEM, replace/ACTIVITY, new gasket/ITEM, fit over the thread of the drain plug/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: wipe down the area around the drain plug with a clean rag or towel .
tagged_text: wipe down/ACTIVITY, area/LOCATION, drain plug/ITEM, clean/SPECIFIER, rag/MATERIAL, towel/MATERIAL,

preprocessed_text: reinstall the drain plug and tighten it a much a you can by hand .
tagged_text: reinstall/ACTIVITY, drain plug/ITEM, tighten/ACTIVITY, much/SPECIFIER, as you can/SPECIFIER, by hand/TOOL,

preprocessed_text: use a 17 mm box end wrench to tighten the drain plug until it is snug .
tagged_text: use/NOISE, 17 mm box end wrench/TOOL, tighten/ACTIVITY, drain plug/ITEM, snug/SPECIFIER,

preprocessed_text: move the oil drain pan so that it is directly under the oil filter .
tagged_text: move/ACTIVITY, oil drain pan/ITEM, directly under the oil filter/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: remove the oil filter by turning it counterclockwise until it come free .
tagged_text: remove/ACTIVITY, oil filter/ITEM, turning/ACTIVITY, counterclockwise/SPECIFIER, come free/OBSERVATION,

preprocessed_text: if the filter is on too tightly to remove by hand , use an oil filter wrench to loosen it first , then continue to remove it by hand .
tagged_text: filter/ITEM, remove/ACTIVITY, by hand/TOOL, oil filter wrench/TOOL, loosen/ACTIVITY, continue/ACTIVITY,

preprocessed_text: place the oil filter with the open end facing down onto the oil drain pan to allow the old oil to drain out .
tagged_text: place/ACTIVITY, oil filter/ITEM, open end/ITEM, facing down/SPECIFIER, oil drain pan/ITEM, allow/ACTIVITY, old oil/MATERIAL, drain out/ACTIVITY,

preprocessed_text: dip a clean , gloved finger into a fresh bottle of oil and spread a thin layer of oil on the new oil filter 's gasket .
tagged_text: dip/ACTIVITY, clean/SPECIFIER, gloved finger/ITEM, fresh bottle of oil/MATERIAL, spread/ACTIVITY, thin/SPECIFIER, layer/ITEM, oil/MATERIAL, new oil filter/ITEM, gasket/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: wipe off the oil filter thread and contact area on the engine with a clean rag or towel .
tagged_text: wipe/ACTIVITY, oil filter/ITEM, thread/ITEM, contact area/LOCATION, engine/ITEM, clean/SPECIFIER, rag/MATERIAL, towel/MATERIAL,

preprocessed_text: place the new oil filter over the thread and turn it clockwise until it is snug .
tagged_text: place/ACTIVITY, new/SPECIFIER, oil filter/ITEM, thread/ITEM, turn/ACTIVITY, clockwise/SPECIFIER, snug/SPECIFIER,

preprocessed_text: twist the oil filler cap counterclockwise and remove it from the valve cover .
tagged_text: twist/ACTIVITY, oil filler cap/ITEM, counterclockwise/SPECIFIER, remove/ACTIVITY, valve cover/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: place a funnel in the oil filler hole .
tagged_text: place/ACTIVITY, funnel/ITEM, oil filler hole/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: hold the funnel with one hand to steady it and pour 5.1 quart of 15 w-40 oil into the funnel .
tagged_text: hold/ACTIVITY, funnel/ITEM, steady/SPECIFIER, pour/ACTIVITY, 5.1 quart/CARDINALITY, 15 w-40 oil/MATERIAL, into the funnel/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: reinstall the oil filler cap and turn it clockwise until it is snug .
tagged_text: reinstall/ACTIVITY, oil filler/ITEM, cap/ITEM, turn/ACTIVITY, clockwise/SPECIFIER, snug/SPECIFIER,

preprocessed_text: remove the dipstick , wipe it off with a clean rag or towel , reinsert it , and remove it again .
tagged_text: remove/ACTIVITY, dipstick/ITEM, wipe/ACTIVITY, clean/SPECIFIER, rag/MATERIAL, towel/MATERIAL, reinsert/ACTIVITY, remove/ACTIVITY,

preprocessed_text: reinsert the dipstick and add or remove any oil , if necessary .
tagged_text: reinsert/ACTIVITY, dipstick/ITEM, add/ACTIVITY, remove/ACTIVITY, oil/MATERIAL, necessary/SPECIFIER,

preprocessed_text: place the engine panel back in it original location , making sure the two retaining tab go through their respective slot in the panel .
tagged_text: place/ACTIVITY, engine panel/ITEM, back/LOCATION, original/SPECIFIER, making sure/NOISE, two/CARDINALITY, retaining tab/ITEM, go through their respective slot in the panel/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: secure the engine panel by pulling the retaining tab straight out , turning them 90 , and laying them down flat .
tagged_text: secure/ACTIVITY, engine panel/ITEM, pulling/ACTIVITY, retaining tab/ITEM, straight out/LOCATION, turning/ACTIVITY, 90/SPECIFIER, laying/ACTIVITY, flat/SPECIFIER,

preprocessed_text: hold the hood up with one hand and use the other hand to return the hood prop to it original location
tagged_text: hold/ACTIVITY, hood/ITEM, up/LOCATION, one hand/LOCATION, use/ACTIVITY, other hand/LOCATION, return/ACTIVITY, hood prop/ITEM, to it original location/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: close the hood firmly and make sure that the hood latch engages .
tagged_text: close/ACTIVITY, hood/ITEM, firmly/SPECIFIER, make sure/ACTIVITY, hood latch/ITEM, engages/ACTIVITY,

preprocessed_text: open the rear part of the middle console .
tagged_text: open/ACTIVITY, rear part/ITEM, middle console/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: grip the right side of the console and pull up towards the passenger seat to remove it .
tagged_text: grip/ACTIVITY, right side/LOCATION, console/ITEM, pull/ACTIVITY, up/SPECIFIER, passenger seat/LOCATION, remove/ACTIVITY,

preprocessed_text: locate the two bolt under the air conditioning control at the bottom of the face plate .
tagged_text: locate/ACTIVITY, two/CARDINALITY, bolt/ITEM, under the air conditioning control/LOCATION, at the bottom of the face plate/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: loosen these two bolt with a basic socket wrench suited for 7 mm bolt .
tagged_text: loosen/ACTIVITY, two/CARDINALITY, bolt/ITEM, basic socket wrench/TOOL, suited for 7 mm bolt/SPECIFIER,

preprocessed_text: wedge a spudger or plastic opening tool ( in place of the screwdriver shown ) under the top of the face plate .
tagged_text: wedge/ACTIVITY, spudger/TOOL, plastic opening tool/TOOL, top/LOCATION, face plate/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: apply pressure until the corner pop out of place .
tagged_text: apply pressure/ACTIVITY, corner/ITEM, pop out of place/ACTIVITY,

preprocessed_text: inspect the interior of the center console for damaged wire or other faulty component .
tagged_text: inspect/ACTIVITY, interior/LOCATION, center console/ITEM, damaged wire/ITEM, faulty component/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: remove 4 , 7.9 mm nut using a 7.9 mm socket driver head
tagged_text: remove/ACTIVITY, 4 7.9 mm nut/ITEM, using/NOISE, 7.9 mm socket driver head/TOOL,

preprocessed_text: one of the nut is placed underneath the l-bracket . remove the l-bracket and the 3 circled nut before attempting to remove the remaining nut
tagged_text: one of the nut/CARDINALITY, placed underneath the l-bracket/LOCATION, remove/ACTIVITY, l-bracket/ITEM, 3 circled nut/CARDINALITY, attempting to remove/ACTIVITY, remaining nut/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: pull cover off the body of the alternator
tagged_text: pull/ACTIVITY, cover/ITEM, body/ITEM, alternator/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: with the alternator cover removed , use a 2 phillips screwdriver to remove the two , 6 mm screw that hold the brush cover in place .
tagged_text: with the alternator cover removed/NOISE, use/NOISE, 2 phillips screwdriver/TOOL, remove/ACTIVITY, two/CARDINALITY, 6 mm screw/ITEM, hold/ACTIVITY, brush cover/ITEM, in place/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: remove the brush cover assembly from the alternator . you might need to insert a needle in the small hole to separate the brush from the rotor . pull it out without using much force to avoid damage .
tagged_text: remove/ACTIVITY, brush cover assembly/ITEM, alternator/ITEM, insert/ACTIVITY, needle/TOOL, small hole/LOCATION, separate/ACTIVITY, brush/ITEM, rotor/ITEM, pull/ACTIVITY, without using much force/SPECIFIER, avoid/ACTIVITY, damage/OBSERVATION,

preprocessed_text: avoid disconnecting wire unless otherwise specified !
tagged_text: avoid disconnecting wire unless otherwise specified/NOISE,

preprocessed_text: use a 2 phillips screwdriver to remove the two 6 mm screw holding down the voltage regulator
tagged_text: use/NOISE, 2 phillips screwdriver/TOOL, remove/ACTIVITY, two/CARDINALITY, 6 mm screw/ITEM, holding down the voltage regulator/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: locate and unscrew the 3 , 6 mm screw holding the bridge assembly in place
tagged_text: locate/ACTIVITY, unscrew/ACTIVITY, 3 6 mm screw/ITEM, holding the bridge assembly in place/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: locate the copper lead connecting the stator to the bridge assembly . there are 3 set of 2 lead on the perimeter of the bridge , making 6 lead total .
tagged_text: locate/ACTIVITY, copper lead/ITEM, connecting/ACTIVITY, stator/ITEM, bridge assembly/ITEM, 3 set of 2 lead/CARDINALITY, perimeter of the bridge/LOCATION, 6 lead total/CARDINALITY,

preprocessed_text: these lead must be cut in order to remove the bridge from the alternator . these lead will have to be soldered back together on reassembly . keep the cut a clean a possible .
tagged_text: these lead/ITEM, cut/ACTIVITY, remove/ACTIVITY, bridge/ITEM, alternator/ITEM, soldered/ACTIVITY, reassembly/ACTIVITY, keep/ACTIVITY, clean/SPECIFIER, possible/SPECIFIER,

preprocessed_text: use wire cutter to cut all 6 of the lead on the perimeter of the bridge .
tagged_text: use/NOISE, wire cutter/TOOL, cut/ACTIVITY, all/CARDINALITY, 6/CARDINALITY, lead/ITEM, on the perimeter of the bridge/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: if necessary , use a pry bar to gently raise the top of the bridge assembly off the alternator
tagged_text: if necessary/NOISE, use/ACTIVITY, pry bar/TOOL, gently/SPECIFIER, raise/ACTIVITY, top of the bridge assembly/ITEM, off the alternator/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: remove the lower section of the bridge assembly
tagged_text: remove/ACTIVITY, lower section/ITEM, bridge assembly/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: use a phillips 2 screwdriver or a 7.5 mm socket driver to unscrew the 4 , 7.5 mm bolt running along the outer perimeter of the alternator
tagged_text: use/NOISE, phillips 2 screwdriver/TOOL, 7.5 mm socket driver/TOOL, unscrew/ACTIVITY, 4/CARDINALITY, 7.5 mm bolt/ITEM, running along the outer perimeter of the alternator/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: use a c-clamp or another fixture to hold the pulley in place
tagged_text: use/NOISE, c-clamp/TOOL, another fixture/TOOL, hold/ACTIVITY, pulley/ITEM, in place/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: be gentle with the clamp . excessive force will bend the pulley out of shape
tagged_text: be gentle with the clamp/NOISE, excessive force/SPECIFIER, bend/ACTIVITY, pulley/ITEM, out of shape/SPECIFIER,

preprocessed_text: use a ratchet with a 25 mm socket to remove the 25 mm hex nut from the pulley
tagged_text: use/NOISE, ratchet/TOOL, 25 mm socket/TOOL, remove/ACTIVITY, 25 mm hex nut/ITEM, from the pulley/LOCATION,

preprocessed_text: once the nut is off , you can then remove the pulley .
tagged_text: once the nut is off/NOISE, remove/ACTIVITY, pulley/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: once the pulley is removed , separate the rotor and stator . the stator is the piece with copper winding .
tagged_text: once the pulley is removed/NOISE, separate/ACTIVITY, rotor/ITEM, stator/ITEM, piece/ITEM, copper winding/ITEM,

preprocessed_text: you can pull the stator out of the remaining cover and examine it .
tagged_text: pull/ACTIVITY, stator/ITEM, out of the remaining cover/LOCATION, examine/ACTIVITY,

preprocessed_text: if the stator is scratched or damaged , you will need to replace it . look for scoring mark or cut piece of winding .
tagged_text: if the stator is scratched or damaged/OBSERVATION, replace/ACTIVITY, look/ACTIVITY, scoring mark/OBSERVATION, cut piece of winding/OBSERVATION,
